The company is poised to create efficiency and viability in the Infrastructure, healthcare, energy, retail and commodity sector while attracting investment and management of this portfolio to ensure sustainable growth and directly impact on service delivery across targeted ecosystems.

We are recruiting to fill position below:

Job Position: Hotel Procurement Officer

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Job Type: Full time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The hotel procurement officer is to manage and coordinate the procurement of all goods and services required by the hotel to ensure timely availability, cost-effectiveness, and compliance with company policies and standards.
	This role supports hotel operations by sourcing quality materials, negotiating contracts, and maintaining supplier relationships to achieve savings and operational efficiency.


Key Responsibilities


	Source and procure direct and indirect materials, goods, and services to meet the hotel’s operational needs while adhering to procurement policies and procedures.
	Establish and maintain favorable contracts and agreements with approved suppliers, ensuring best value and compliance with management approval.
	Coordinate the movement, delivery, and proper storage of goods from suppliers to the hotel, ensuring traceability and quality standards.
	Monitor supplier performance and maintain positive supplier relations to support the hotel’s operational requirements.
	Implement and enforce procurement policies, procedures, and controls to ensure transparency and accountability in all purchasing activities.
	Prepare and present procurement budgets and savings reports to management for financial planning and review.
	Collaborate with Accounts, Operations, and other departments to ensure alignment of procurement activities with business objectives.
	Maintain accurate records of procurement transactions, contracts, and supplier evaluations.
	Identify cost-saving opportunities and recommend improvements in procurement processes.
	Ensure compliance with relevant corporate regulations, local legislation, and hotel standards.


Qualifications and Experience


	Bachelor’s Degree in Procurement, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in procurement, preferably within the hospitality industry.
	Knowledge of procurement best practices, contract management, and supplier evaluation.
	Strong negotiation, influencing, and communication skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office, particularly Excel, and procurement software/systems.
	Ability to analyze data and prepare reports to support decision-making.
	Understanding of financial evaluations and budget management.
	Knowledge of corporate procurement policies and local regulatory requirements.
	Attention to detail and accuracy
	Strong organizational and time management skills
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team
	Problem-solving and analytical thinking
	Customer service orientation and interpersonal skills


Salary Range
N150,000 - N200,000

	Health and Pension cover

title: Job Openings at Nirvana Synergy
content:
Nirvana Synergy company was founded in 2019. Nirvana Synergy is a company that has a vision to provide top quality products that solves everyday challenges of our customers in Nigeria and beyond.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Entry Level Accountant

Job Location: Okota, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Overview
     

            
    




	The accountant would be responsible for maintaining financial records, running reports, recording a wide range of transactions and provide trustworthy information about financial records.
	They would also be responsible for tracking and managing the inventory account.


Responsibilities and Duties


	Managing and tracking all account transactions.
	Audit financial transactions and documents.
	Reconciling account payable and receivables.
	Filling tax, vat, Payee and Pension
	Handle monthly, quarterly and annual closings.
	Manage balance sheets and profit and loss statements.
	Reporting and advising on company’s financial health.
	Preparing financial statements and reports.
	Complying with financial policies and regulations.


Job Requirement


	Must have relevant qualification in Accounting, finance or any related courses.
	Must have at least 1 years of experience as an accountant.
	Must have hands on experience with Ms Excel.
	Must have excellent knowledge of accounting regulations and procedures.
	Must have strong attention to detail and good analytics skill.
	Must live within Okota / Ago /Isolo and environs.


Salary
N140,000 monthly.

Application Closing Date: 17th February, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV in pdf format to: [email protected] using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Telesales Representative

Job Location: Okota - Isolo, Lagos (On-site)
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Customer relations
Reports to: Team lead/Supervisor

Job Summary


	The Telesales Representative is responsible for promoting and selling the company’s products over the phone, managing customer inquiries, and closing sales orders.
	This role requires excellent communication skills, persuasive ability, and a strong customer service orientation to achieve set sales targets and contribute to business growth.


Key Responsibilities


	Contact potential and existing customers to inform them about products, promotions, and offers.
	Understand customer needs and recommend suitable products or solutions.
	Accurately record customer information and order details in the CRM system.
	Follow up on leads and maintain active communication with customers to close sales.
	Handle inbound and outbound sales calls professionally and efficiently.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with customers to encourage repeat business.
	Meet or exceed individual and team sales targets and KPIs.
	Coordinate with logistics and customer service teams to ensure smooth order processing and delivery.
	Provide feedback from customers to the sales and marketing teams for product improvement.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Number of calls made per day/week
	Sales conversion rate
	Revenue generated
	Customer retention and repeat purchase rate
	Accuracy of order processing.


Requirements


	Minimum of OND/NCE; a Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field is an advantage.
	Proven experience in telesales, telemarketing, or customer service (preferably in FMCG, retail, or cosmetics).
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
	Strong persuasive ability and confidence in closing sales.
	Good computer literacy and familiarity with CRM or call management software.
	Goal-oriented, self-motivated, and able to work under minimal supervision.
	A positive attitude and resilience in handling rejection.
	Applicant must reside within and around Okota/Isolo.


Application Closing Date: 11th February, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV in PDF to: [email protected] using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

3.) Social Media Community Manager

Job Location: Okota, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Overview


	The Media & Communications Manager will play a crucial role in shaping and fostering a vibrant online community around our brands and products.
	This person will be responsible for creating engaging and authentic contents, building relationships with our audience and leveraging various social media platforms to enhance brand visibility and community engagements.


Responsibilities and Duties


	Developing and implementing a community engagement strategy aligned with the brand while fostering a sense of community with the audience/customers.
	Creating and curating compelling video contents featuring personal interactions showcasing and speaking about our products for social media, forums, and communities.
	Monitoring social media trends and industry developments to identify opportunities for engagement and content creation.
	Identifying and collaborating with influencers and brand ambassadors to extend reach and strengthen community.
	Maintaining brand presence and engagements and responding timely to community inquiries, comments, and feedback.
	Organizing and executing online/offline community events or campaigns, webinars and challenges while encouraging participation to foster community interactions and loyalty.


Job Requirements


	Must have at least an HND qualification.
	Must be able to feature in creative video contents.
	Must have proven experience as a social media manager, community manager or a similar role.
	Must have good understanding on the use of social media.

HSE Manager Job at Invealth Partners Limited




        
    

        
        Invealth Partners Limited is an Investment and Management company with a focus on creating investment opportunities and strategic partnerships in the African continent. The company is poised to create efficiency and viability in the Infrastructure, healthcare, energy, retail and commodity sector while attracting investment and management of this portfolio to ensure sustainable growth and directly impact on service delivery across targeted ecosystems.

We are recruiting to fill position below:

Job Position: HSE Manager

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Job Type: Full time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The HSE Supervisor is accountable for establishing and enforcing a robust Health, Safety, and Environmental management system for the Jubilee Project, ensuring that all works are conducted in compliance with statutory requirements and project standards.
	The HSE Supervisor holds stop-work authority where unsafe acts/conditions exist and is responsible for incident prevention, training, inspections, investigations, and continuous improvement.


Main Duties


	Develop and implement the Project HSE Plan, including risk assessments, controls, site rules, and emergency response plans.
	Establish reporting systems: hazard reporting, near-miss logs, incident tracking, audit calendars.
	Conduct daily site walks, inspections, and enforcement actions for compliance breaches.
	Ensure PPE compliance, work-at-height controls, lifting operations controls, electrical safety, excavation safety, and housekeeping standards.
	Implement Permit-to-Work (if applicable) and control high-risk activities.
	Ensure 100% HSE induction for all workers and visitors.
	Conduct toolbox talks and targeted training for high-risk activities.
	Lead safety campaigns, drills, and behavioural safety initiatives.
	Lead incident and near-miss investigations, root cause analysis, corrective/preventive action tracking.
	Maintain accurate records suitable for audits and regulatory review.
	Report trends and recommend systemic improvements to PM and Board.
	Maintain emergency response readiness: first aid, fire safety, evacuation drills.
	Implement waste management and environmental protection controls appropriate to the site.


Requirements


	Recognized HSE qualification or certification (NEBOSH, IOSH, or equivalent); strongly preferred.
	Minimum of 5 years of HSE experience on construction sites, including strong exposure to high?risk controls.
	Strong competence in incident investigation, documentation, and reporting.
